qas.question: What group was divided into Twelve Tribes?
When was the Kingdom of Israel conquered by the Neo-Assyrian Empire?
From where do the Jews derive their ethonynm?
How many tribes were the Samaritans split into?
Who do the tribes of Judah descend from?
Where did the Southern Kingdom of Israel migrate to?

plausible_answers.text: the remnants of the northern Kingdom of Israel

qas.question: When did the Kingdom of Israel conquer the Neo-Assyrian Empire?

context: Although the <a0_0>Israelites<a0_0/> were divided into <b3_0>Twelve<b3_0/> Tribes, the Jews (being one offshoot of the Israelites, another being <b4_0>the Samaritans<b4_0/>) are traditionally said to descend mostly from the <a2_0>Israelite tribes of Judah<a2_0/> (from where the Jews derive their ethnonym) and Benjamin, and partially from the tribe of Levi, who had together formed the ancient Kingdom of Judah, and <b6_0>the remnants of the northern Kingdom of Israel<b6_0/> who migrated to <b5_0>the Kingdom of Judah<b5_0/> and assimilated <a1_0>after the <b7_0>720s BCE<b7_0/><a1_0/>, when the Kingdom of Israel was conquered by the Neo-Assyrian Empire.
